message: All metadata fields for the indicator 3-8-1, translated into en
data: Goal 3. Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages3.8 Ensure that everyone has universal health coverage, including protection against financial risks and providing access to quality essential health services and to safe, effective, quality and cost-effective essential medicines and vaccines. affordable3.8.1. % of children fully immunized2020ISTEEBUNDAYISENGA ModestDepartment of Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring, Ponit focal ODDHead of Service and Focal Point79401937ndayimode2010@gmail.comThis is the proportion of children aged 12 to 23 months who received all doses of vaccines%EDSB-III, 2016-2017Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaireThe probable date of the next collection will be 2021 (Next DHS)In 2022ISTEEBUISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national levelISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.The indicator is relevant because it reflects the demographic and health situation of the population.Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive.Number of children aged 12 to 23 months who received all doses of vaccine multiplied by 100 and divided by the expected population of 12 to 23 months.The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publicationThe indicator is available at national level, province, area of residence (Total; Urban area; Rural area)The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international levelReport of the Demographic and Health Survey 2016-2017
